content:
XmlDataProvider Class

Definition

Enables declarative access to XML data for data binding.

In this Article

[System.Windows.Localizability(System.Windows.LocalizationCategory.None, Readability=System.Windows.Readability.Unreadable)]
[System.Windows.Markup.ContentProperty("XmlSerializer")]
public class XmlDataProvider : System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider, System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext
Inheritance
Object
DataSourceProvider
XmlDataProvider
Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute ContentPropertyAttribute

Remarks

Important

In a partial-trust sandbox, XmlDataProvider fails when it does not have permissions to access the given data. For more information about partial trust security, see WPF Partial Trust Security.

XmlDataProvider exposes the following ways to access XML data.

  • You can embed inline XML data using the XmlDataProvider class.

  • You can set the Source property to the Uri of an XML data file.

  • You can set the Document property to an XmlDocument.

XmlDataProvider performs a full refresh of all bindings when a System.Xml.XmlDocument.NodeChanged event occurs. There are no optimizations for specific nodes.

The IsAsynchronous property is set to true by default, which means that the XmlDataProvider retrieves data and produces the collection of XML nodes asynchronously by default.

Constructors

Initializes a new instance of the XmlDataProvider class.

public XmlDataProvider ();

BaseUri

This type or member supports the WPF infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

protected virtual Uri BaseUri { get; set; }
Value
Uri

The base URI.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute ContentPropertyAttribute

Document

Gets or sets the XmlDocument to use as the binding source.

public System.Xml.XmlDocument Document { get; set; }
Value
XmlDocument

The XmlDocument to use as the binding source. The default value is null.

Attributes
DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute

Remarks

XmlDataProvider exposes the following ways to access XML data.

  • You can embed inline XML data using the XmlDataProvider class.

  • You can set the Source property to the Uri of an XML data file.

  • You can set this property to an XmlDocument.

XmlDataProvider performs a full refresh of all bindings on when a System.Xml.XmlDocument.NodeChanged event occurs. There are no optimizations for specific nodes.

If the Source property is set, then any inline XML data is discarded. If the Document property is set, then the Source property is cleared and any inline XML data is discarded.

Setting the following properties will implicitly cause this XmlDataProvider object to refresh: Source, Document, XmlNamespaceManager, and XPath. When changing multiple refresh-causing properties, the use of DeferRefresh is recommended.

IsAsynchronous

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether node collection creation will be performed in a worker thread or in the active context.

public bool IsAsynchronous { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true to perform node collection creation in a worker thread; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

Attributes
DefaultValueAttribute

Source

Gets or sets the Uri of the XML data file to use as the binding source.

public Uri Source { get; set; }
Value
Uri

The Uri of the XML data file to use as the binding source. The default value is null.

Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute ContentPropertyAttribute

Remarks

XmlDataProvider exposes the following ways to access XML data.

  • You can embed inline XML data using the XmlDataProvider class.

  • You can set this property to the Uri of an XML data file.

  • You can set the Document property to an XmlDocument.

If the Source property is set, then any inline XML data is discarded. If the Document property is set, then the Source property is cleared and any inline XML data is discarded.

Setting the following properties will implicitly cause this XmlDataProvider object to refresh: Source, Document, XmlNamespaceManager, and XPath. When changing multiple refresh-causing properties, the use of DeferRefresh is recommended.

XmlNamespaceManager

Gets or sets the XmlNamespaceManager used to run stem.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath* queries.

public System.Xml.XmlNamespaceManager XmlNamespaceManager { get; set; }
Value
XmlNamespaceManager

The XmlNamespaceManager used to run stem.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath* queries. The default value is null.

Attributes
DefaultValueAttribute

Remarks

Setting the following properties will implicitly cause this XmlDataProvider object to refresh: Source, Document, XmlNamespaceManager, and XPath. When changing multiple refresh-causing properties, the use of DeferRefresh is recommended.

XAML Attribute Usage

<object XmlNamespaceManager="mappingCollection"/>

XAML Values

mappingCollection
An XmlNamespaceMappingCollection. To refer to a XmlNamespaceMappingCollection, use the Markup Extensions and WPF XAML.

XmlSerializer

Gets the inline XML content.

public System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable XmlSerializer { get; }
Value
IXmlSerializable

The inline XML content.

Attributes
DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This property is used by the parser to compile the literal content of the embedded XML data island.

XAML Property Element Usage

<XmlDataProvider>  
  <XmlDataProvider.XmlSerializer>  
    <x:XData>  
       <elementDataRoot>  
          <elementData/>  
       <elementDataRoot>  
    </x:XData>  
  </XmlDataProvider.XmlSerializer>  
</XmlDataProvider>  
--or--  
<XmlDataProvider>  
    <x:XData>  
       <elementDataRoot>  
          <elementData/>  
       <elementDataRoot>  
    </x:XData>  
</XmlDataProvider>

XAML Values

elementDataRoot
Required. The single root element of the enclosed data island. Without a single root, the x:XData is invalid as a data source.

elementData
Optional. XML that represents your data. Any number of elements can be contained as element data, nested elements can be contained in other elements, and so on, subject to the general rules of XML.

XPath

Gets or sets the XPath query used to generate the data collection.

public string XPath { get; set; }
Value
String

The XPath query used to generate the data collection. The default is an empty string.

Attributes
DesignerSerializationOptionsAttribute

Remarks

The SelectNodes method handles the XPath expressions from the XPath property. XPath functions are not supported. For XPath expression information, see the SelectNodes documentation and some examples provided in the Example section.

Setting the following properties will implicitly cause this XmlDataProvider object to refresh: Source, Document, XmlNamespaceManager, and XPath. When changing multiple refresh-causing properties, the use of DeferRefresh is recommended.

Methods

BeginQuery()

Prepares the loading of either the inline XML or the external XML file to produce a collection of XML nodes.

protected override void BeginQuery ();
Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute ContentPropertyAttribute

Remarks

The execution is either immediate or on a background thread, based on the value of the IsAsynchronous property.

This method is called by the InitialLoad and Refresh methods of the base class.

EndInit()

Indicates that the initialization of this element has completed; this causes a stem.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh* if no other stem.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DeferRefresh* is outstanding.

protected override void EndInit ();
Attributes
LocalizabilityAttribute ContentPropertyAttribute

ShouldSerializeSource()

Indicates whether the stem.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.Source* property should be persisted.

public bool ShouldSerializeSource ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, false.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This ShouldSerialize method is provided because the Source property does not have a simple default value. This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value. You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the XmlDataProvider or developing your own control incorporating the XmlDataProvider.

ShouldSerializeXmlSerializer()

Indicates whether the stem.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XmlSerializer* property should be persisted.

public bool ShouldSerializeXmlSerializer ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, false.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This ShouldSerialize method is provided because the XmlSerializer property does not have a simple default value. This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value. You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the XmlDataProvider or developing your own control incorporating the XmlDataProvider.

ShouldSerializeXPath()

Indicates whether the stem.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider.XPath* property should be persisted.

public bool ShouldSerializeXPath ();
Returns
Boolean

true if the property value has changed from its default; otherwise, false.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This ShouldSerialize method is provided because the XPath property does not have a simple default value. This method indicates whether the property has changed from its default value. You typically invoke this method if you are either developing a designer for the XmlDataProvider or developing your own control incorporating the XmlDataProvider.

Explicit Interface Implementations

This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

Returns
Uri

The base URI.
